page.title: 18Free Newspaper, St Ives
page.content: The Town Crier is a free tabloid newspaper published in St Ives. There are four editions which cover an area from St Neots to Cambridge and the Fens. The paper was started in 1973 and the main office is situated in the old courtroom and police station in St Ives. It has developed from just an advertising sheet to a newspaper with various editorial articles and extensive advertising space. 150,000 copies are distributed over the area by schoolchildren watched over by supervisors who are responsible for 3,000 copies each. Thirteen people are involved in the production of the paper. There are three editorial staff, three type-setters, three paste-up staff and four proof-readers. The paper is printed in Diss. The paper may be printed in full colour soon.
